Description: PURPOSE:  THE PROJECT IS TO INSTALL FIVE GATES ON SACK DAM TO IMPROVE FLOW CONTROL CAPABILITIES AND MEASUREMENT ACCURACY THROUGH THE STRUCTURE IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE RIVER FLOWS AND THE NECESSARY SAN JOAQUIN RIVER RESTORATION FLOWS, AS DESCRIBED IN THE SETTLEMENT ACT, PUBLIC LAW 111-11.ACTIVITIES: IMPROVE FLOW CONTROL CAPABILITIES THROUGH SACK DAM.  SACK DAM WAS DESIGNED TO IMPOUND FLOWS RELEASED FROM MENDOTA DAM FOR DIVERSIONS INTO THE ARROYO CANAL PURSUANT TO THE EXCHANGE CONTRACT. IT WAS NOT DESIGNED TO ACCURATELY PASS MEASURED FLOW. THE NEW GATES WILL IMPROVE THE ACCURACY TO PASS FLOWS THROUGH SACK DAM, AS OPPOSED TO OVER SACK DAM.  THE NEW GATES WILL BE RATED  THEREFORE, ACCURATE MEASUREMENT CAN BE MAINTAINED THROUGH EACH OF THE GATES AT ALL FLOW RATES WHILE MAINTAINING THE NECESSARY WATER SURFACE ELEVATION UPSTREAM OF THE DAM FOR DIVERSIONS INTO THE ARROYO CANAL.  OBJECTIVE 2:THE NEW GATES WILL BE AUTOMATED AND REDUCE THE FREQUENCY THAT STAFF HAVE TO PHYSICAL REMOVE AND REPLACE THE BOARDS.  AUTOMATION INCREASES THE SAFETY OF STAFF IF THEY DO NOT NEED TO PULL AND REPLACE BOARDS.OBJECTIVE 3:THE NEW GATES WILL REDUCE LEAKAGE IN THE 5 BAYS THEY ARE INSTALLED IN AND REDUCE UNMEASURED SPILLAGE.  OBJECTIVE 4:THE NEW GATES WILL REMOTELY PROVIDE REAL TIME FLOW DATA AND ALLOW FOR THE SHARING OF DATA WITH THE PROGRAM FOR TRACKING FLOWS AND HMRD FOR OPERATIONS.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOME:  THE PROJECT IS FOCUSED ON IMPROVING THE EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT OPERATIONS OF THE SACK DAM AND IMPROVING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SETTLEMENT IN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY AND ECONOMICALLY SOUND MANNER.BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC

1.  AWARD PURPOSE - THE RESTORATION GOAL IS TO REINTRODUCE SPRING-RUN ANDFALL-RUN CHINOOK SALMON TO THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER BETWEEN THE FRIANT DAM AND THECONFLUENCE WITH THE MERCED RIVER. IN ACCORDANCE WITH PARAGRAPH 14, THE UNITED STATES FISH   WILDLIFE (USFWS) SUBMITTED A COMPLETE PERMIT APPLICATION TO THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE (NMFS) FOR REINTRODUCTION OF SPRING-RUN CHINOOK SALMON. ON OCTOBER 11, 2012, NMFS ISSUED SECTION 10(A)(1)(A) PERMIT 14868. THIS PERMIT AUTHORIZES USFWS TO COLLECT, TRANSPORT, REAR, HANDLE, AND TAG INDIVIDUALS TO ESTABLISH A BROODSTOCK OF SPRING-RUN AT THE INTERIM FACILITY, THE SATELLITE INCUBATION AND REARING FACILITY (SIRF), AND THE FUTURE SAN JOAQUIN SALMON CONSERVATION AND RESEARCH FACILITY (SCARF) LOCATED ON THE GROUNDS OF THE EXISTING SAN JOAQUIN FISH HATCHERY IN FRIANT,CALIFORNIA. NO OTHER FACILITIES ARE AUTHORIZED IN THE PERMIT.2.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE:1.  DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A GENETICALLY DIVERSE BROODSTOCK OF SPRING AND POTENTIALLY FALL-RUN CHINOOK TO SUPPORT THE RESTORATION OF CHINOOK SALMON TO SELF-SUSTAINING LEVELS.2.  PRODUCE TARGETS SET BY THE SJRRP TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PRACTICABLE GIVEN THE LIMITATIONS OF TANK SPACE AND WATER SUPPLY AT THE INTERIM FACILITY, UNTIL THE FULL- SCALE CONSERVATION FACILITY BECOMES OPERATIONAL.3.  PRODUCE JUVENILE SPRING-RUN CHINOOK TO SUPPORT THE RESTORATION OF CHINOOK SALMON RUNS TO SELF-SUSTAINING LEVELS.4.  ONCE CONSERVATION FACILITY IS OPERATIONAL, CONTINUE TO OPERATE THE INTERIM FACILITY AS REPURPOSED FOR QUARANTINE FACILITY, RESEARCH FACILITY, AND TO HOLD SPAWN RETURNING SPRING-RUN ADULTS FROM THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER FOR EVENTUAL INCORPORATION INTO SCARF BROODSTOCK.5.  OPERATE THE SIRF ON RECLAMATION PROPERTY JUST BELOW FRIANT DAM IN SUPPORT OF SCARF OPERATIONS AND PROGRAM OBJECTIVES.6.  SUPPORT AND PROVIDE RESEARCH NEEDS ASSOCIATED WITH RESTORING SPRING AND OR FALL- RUN CHINOOK POPULATIONS TO SELF-SUSTAINING LEVELS.7.  PREPARE A CONSERVATION PROGRAM ANNUAL REPORT TO NMFS, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCHEDULE OF ANY APPLICABLE HGMP OR SJRRP GUIDANCE.3.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME - THE BENEFITS TO BE DERIVED FROM THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: CDFW OPERATING ANDMAINTAINING SCARF IN A MANNER THAT PRODUCES SPRING-RUN CHINOOK SALMON TO BE RELEASED TO THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER IN SUPPORT OF THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENTS RESTORATION GOAL TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN FISH POPULATIONS IN GOOD CONDITION IN THE MAIN STEM OF THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER BELOW FRIANT DAM TO THE CONFLUENCE OF THE MERCED RIVER, INCLUDING NATURALLY REPRODUCING AND SELF-SUSTAINING POPULATIONS OF SALMON AND OTHER FISH.THE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT WORKGROUP OF THE SJRRP DETERMINED THAT DEVELOPMENT OF A CAPTIVE REARING PROGRAM IS CRITICAL TO THE LONG-TERM SUCCESS OF RESTORING SPRING-RUN CHINOOK SALMON TO THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER (SJRRP 2010, FMWG 2011). ACCORDINGLY, THE SJRRP PROPOSED DEVELOPMENT OF THE SCARF. FACILITY OPERATIONS ARE AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE COORDINATED WITH A MULTI-AGENCY TECHNICAL TEAM THAT WILL PROVIDE INPUT ONOPERATIONS TO ASSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE SJRRPS HATCHERY AND GENETIC MANAGEMENTPLAN (HGMP  SJRRP 2010).4.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) - AS A BENEFIT TO THE PUBLIC, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SPRING-RUN CHINOOK SALMON POPULATION ON THE SAN JOAQUIN RIVER THAT WOULD ENHANCE THE OVERALL ABUNDANCE AND DIVERSITY OF THE SPECIES AND CONTRIBUTE TO ITS RECOVERY.  CONSERVATION FACILITY OPERATIONS WILL PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT SCIENTIFIC CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE FIELD OF FISH REINTRODUCTION AND FOR FISHERIES MANAGEMENT.5.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS AGREEMENT.

PUBLIC PURPOSE: THE SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY HAS GROWING WATER DEFICITS AS A RESULT OF INCREASING POPULATIONS, CHANGES IN LAND USE, GROWING URBAN AND AGRICULTURAL DEMANDS, AND THE NEEDS OF THE ENVIRONMENT. THE REPORT WILL MAXIMIZE THE VALUE OF ONGOING EFFORTS TO CREATE A COMMON WATER VISION FOR THE VALLEY, ADDRESSING THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OUTLINED IN PL 111-11.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:OBJECTIVE 1: PROJECT ADMINISTRATION, INCLUDING CONTRACTING, BILLING, AND FINANCIAL REPORTING TO MEET RECLAMATIONS REQUIREMENTS.OBJECTIVE 2: ENGAGE STAKEHOLDERS THROUGHOUT THE VALLEY IN DEVELOPING THE REPORT.OBJECTIVE 3: DEVELOP THE INITIAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE SEVERITY OF WATER MANAGEMENT PROBLEMS IN THE VALLEY AND DEFINE THE RANGE OF NEEDS AND POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES.OBJECTIVE 4: GATHER EXISTING PROJECT CONCEPTS  EVALUATE CONCEPTS FOR COMPLETENESS  AND GROUP THEM INTO PORTFOLIOS TO ADDRESS THE PROBLEMS, RANGE OF NEEDS, AND RANGE OF OPPORTUNITIES IDENTIFIED IN OBJECTIVE 3.OBJECTIVE 5: DOCUMENTING THE INFORMATION GATHERED IN OBJECTIVE 3 AND OBJECTIVE 4 IN A SINGLE WATER PLAN REPORT THAT WILL ULTIMATELY BE SUBMITTED TO CONGRESS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES   OUTCOME(S):OBJECTIVE 1 OUTCOMES: THE TEAM WILL OVERSEE ALL CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION.OBJECTIVE 2 OUTCOMES: STAKEHOLDERS THROUGHOUT THE CENTRAL VALLEY WILL BE ENGAGED DURING REPORT DEVELOPMENT.OBJECTIVE 3 OUTCOMES: AN INITIAL UNDERSTANDING WILL BE DEVELOPED OF THE SEVERITY OF WATER MANAGEMENT PROBLEMS IN THE VALLEY. EXISTING AND FUTURE CONDITIONS WILL BE PRESENTED FOR THE FOLLOWING TOPICS: WATER QUALITY  WATER SUPPLY (SURFACE WATER AND GROUNDWATER)  WATER CONVEYANCE  WATER RELIABILITY  WATER CONSERVATION AND EFFICIENT FLOOD CONTROL  WATER RESOURCE-RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL ENHANCEMENT  AND POPULATION GROWTH.OBJECTIVE 4 OUTCOMES: OUTLINE THE STEPS NECESSARY TO GATHER EXISTING PROJECT CONCEPTS, EVALUATE CONCEPTS FOR COMPLETENESS, GROUP THEM INTO PORTFOLIOS TO ADDRESS THE PROBLEMS, RANGE OF NEEDS, AND RANGE OF OPPORTUNITIES.OBJECTIVE 5 OUTCOMES: THE FINAL REPORT WILL MEET THE REQUIREMENTS SET BY PL 111-11 AND WILL BE DELIVERED TO CONGRESS.BENEFICIARY: THE PUBLIC
WEED MANAGEMENT AND JOBS CREATION PROJECT, PHASE 3
ENGINEERING AND DESIGN FOR THE MENDOTA POOL FISH SCREEN AND CONTROL STRUCTURE

THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT ARE TO:  (1) DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A GENETICALLY DIVERSE BROOD STOCK OF SPRING AND POTENTIALLY FALL RUN CHINOOK TO SUPPORT THE RESTORATION OF CHINOOK SALMON TO 
SELF-SUSTAINING LEVELS; (2) PRODUCE TARGETS SET BY THE SJRRP TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PRACTICABLE GIVEN THE LIMITATIONS OF TANK SPACE AND WATER SUPPLY AT THE INTERIM FACILITY, UNTIL THE FULL-SCALE CONSERVATION FACILITY BECOMES OPERATIONAL; (3) PRODUCE JUVENILE SPRING-RUN AND FALL-RUN CHINOOK, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON SPRING-RUN CHINOOK PRODUCTION, TO SUPPORT THE RESTORATION OF CHINOOK SALMON RUNS TO SELF-SUSTAINING LEVELS; (4) SUPPORT AND PROVIDE RESEARCH NEEDS ASSOCIATED WITH RESTORING SPRING AND/OR FALL RUN CHINOOK POPULATIONS TO SELF-SUSTAINING LEVELS.
